remarks: Cantor's theorem in terms of cardinals.  This theorem tells us that no matter how large a cardinal number is, there is a still larger cardinal number.  Theorem 18.12 of [Monk1] p. 133.  (Contributed by NM, 5-Nov-2003.)
statement: canth3 $p |- ( A e. V -> ( card ` A ) e. ( card ` ~P A ) ) $.
